result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 9:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Morgan Lee Kamp in court in custody from the Dane County Jail.  Attorney Amanda K. Riek in court for Morgan Lee Kamp. Cases called: 21 CF 153 and 22 CF 50, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 21 CF 153, Court finds defendant guilty, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 in 21 CF 153 dismissed and 22 CF 50 dismissed, read in, Court sentences defendant to: 21 CF 153, Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence, probation 3 years, $518.00 costs, AODA and comply, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, not posses/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia
AMENDED: Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

State said the defendant is in the Dane County Jail and the address has not been updated so no writ was prepared. Court will set new return date to keep this on the calendar. 9:22 AM
Return date scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
